H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3718.def: = state in which an object consists of two layers, ► which enhances its strength

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3474.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface

H4546.def: = a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1516.def: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H4334.def: = an area of fairly level, high ground; ≈ sometimes associated with a lack of obstacles, both literally and figuratively

H1237.def: = a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H6731.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H6731.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5380.def: = process by which air moves across a surface or against an object

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1319.def: = action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H7939.def: = a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions

H6468.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H5095.def: = action by which humans and their domestic animals journey from one place to the other

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3286.def: = process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H2714.def: = action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H3287.def: = state in which humans are weak as a result of an extended period of activity

H6109.def: = state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H202.def: = state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H3286.def: = process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H83.def: = part of the body ◄ of a bird, ► used for flying

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3286.def: = process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity
